items.name: Advanced Pistol
items.description: The Advanced Pistol is the most advanced Tier 4 handgun with the largest ammo capacity, durability and rate of fire. It fires Pistol Ammunition such as Armor Piercing , Explosive , Incendiary , Obsidian or regular 9mm Rounds .

items.name: Anti-materiel Rifle
items.description: The Anti-materiel Rifle is a bolt-action, anti-materiel rifle with a long effective range and an included scope for viewing the target. It fires Sniper Ammunition purchased from the Workshop .

items.name: Assault Rifle
items.description: The Assault Rifle is an automatic firearm with reduced critical damage, +15 round ammo capacity and a high rate of fire. It uses Assault Rifle Ammunition such as Armor Piercing , Explosive , Incendiary , Obsidian or regular 5.56mm Rounds .

items.name: Automated Defense System: Pistol
items.description: Automated Defense System: Pistol is a deployable base defense turret that fires Pistol Ammunition at hostile Fauna .

items.name: Black Wolf Knife
items.description: The Black Wolf Knife is a knife with a 25% chance to inflict hemorrhage on targets and can be used as a tool to skin fauna. For the thrown variant of the Black Wolf Knife, view Black Wolf Throwing Knife .

items.name: Black Wolf Throwing Knife
items.description: The Black Wolf Throwing Knife is a variant of the Black Wolf Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Black Wolf Knife , the Black Wolf Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Bolt Action Rifle
items.description: The Bolt Action Rifle is the first long-range Firearm that prospectors can create. It can utilize the 7.62mm Round , the Incendiary Rifle Round , etc. Along with the Shotgun , it provides Prospectors with a significant increase in survivability when encountering the Fauna of Icarus. The Bolt Action Rifle can fire 75 rounds before breaking, and the talent Gunsmith can increase this to up to a maximum of 90 rounds, so bring a Machining Bench for long trips.

items.name: Bone Knife
items.description: The Bone Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Stone Knife , the Bone Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool.

items.name: Bone Spear
items.description: Spears increase the range to which Prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high. The Bone Spear has twice as much health than the Wood Spear , which can be the difference between winning and losing against Icarus' fauna. Unlike the Bone Javelin , the Bone Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Bone Throwing Knife
items.description: The Bone Throwing Knife is a variant of the Bone Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Bone Knife , the Bone Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: CHAC "Boomstick" Shotgun
items.description: The CHAC "Boomstick" Shotgun is an advanced purchaseable Shotgun with increase projectile and critical damage. It fires any Shotgun Ammunition and is comparable to other Tier 4 Firearms .

items.name: CHAC "Sentinel" Pistol
items.description: The CHAC "Sentinel" Pistol is an advanced handgun with increased projectile and critical damage that is comparable, or better than other Tier 4 Firearms .

items.name: CHAC "Sovereign" Rifle
items.description: The CHAC "Sovereign" Rifle is a purchaseable rifle with a fast reload speed and moderate damage capability.

items.name: Carbon Spear
items.description: The Carbon Spear is an upgrade to the Platinum Spear that deals more damage and is cheaper to craft. Unlike the Carbon Javelin , the Carbon Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Caveworm Bow
items.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows, the Caveworm Bow is harder hitting than the Longbow and is equal in strength to the Recurve Bow .

items.name: Caveworm Knife
items.description: The Caveworm Knife is made with resources obtained from Caveworms . Though the Caveworm Knife can be used as a melee weapon or tool to skin fauna, the Caveworm Knife has very little durability, which can prove problematic while on the go as it can only be repaired at an Anvil Bench .

items.name: Caveworm Spear
items.description: Spears increase the range to which Prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high. Unlike the Caveworm Javelin , the Caveworm Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Caveworm Throwing Knife
items.description: The Caveworm Throwing Knife is a variant of the Caveworm Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Caveworm Knife , the Caveworm Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Cold Steel Axe
items.description: The Cold Steel Axe is a mid/late-game Axe that is introduced with Chapter - New Frontier . The Cold Steel Axe can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

items.name: Cold Steel Knife
items.description: The Cold Steel Knife is a mid/late-game Knife that is introduced with the addition of Cold Steel Ingots on the Prometheus map.

items.name: Cold Steel Pickaxe
items.description: The Cold Steel Pickaxe is a mid/late-game Pickaxe that was introduced with New Frontiers .

items.name: Cold Steel Sledgehammer
items.description: Cold Steel Sledgehammer is a Tier 3 Sledgehammer made with Cold Steel Ingots . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Cold Steel Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike the Cold Steel Javelin , the Cold Steel Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Cold Steel Throwing Knife
items.description: The Cold Steel Throwing Knife is a variant of the Cold Steel Knife that can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching the Cold Steel Knife . Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Combat Knife
items.description: While not particularly good for skinning a carcass, this knife excels in close quarters combat. Cannot be thrown.

items.name: Composite Spear
items.description: The Composite Spear is an upgrade to the Titanium Spear that deals more damage and is cheaper to craft once Composites can be crafted. Despite Composites being a hefty tech investment, the Composite Spear has the highest damage output and durability outside of Prometheus exclusive Spears. Unlike the Composite Javelin , the Composite Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Compound Bow
items.description: The tail-end of the 20th Century brought about many advancements in technology and archery didn't get left behind. A Compound Bow works like a simple block and tackle, multiplying input energy over distance with it's Cam and Idler Wheel pulleys, instead of traditional bow limbs; which allows the Compound Bow to hit harder than the Recurve Bow .

items.name: Crossbow
items.description: The earliest known Crossbows were invented on Earth in the first millennium BC, not later than the 7th century BC in ancient China, not later than the 1st century AD in Greece; on Icarus, Prospectors will test this ancient technology in many challenges to see if it still holds up.

items.name: Frag Grenade
items.description: An explosive weapon thrown by hand. Hold left click to charge a throw. The grenade timer starts when the grenade leaves your hand and will take a few seconds to detonate. Stacks up to 5.
items.crafted_at: the Machining Bench with the following resources:

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Machining Bench with the following resources:

items.name: Gunpowder
items.description: Gunpowder is a precursor resource used in making Ammunition , weapons like the Frag Grenade , and Volatile Substance .

items.name: Hunting Rifle
items.description: An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application of Ranged Attachment Packs at an Alteration Bench / Advanced Alteration Bench .

items.name: Inaris "Agua" Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Agua" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no Workshop Javelins .

items.name: Inaris "Cerulean" Knife
items.description: The Inaris "Cerulean" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing frost damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Inaris "Cerulean" Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshop Throwing Knives .
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe
items.description: The Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing fire damage to targets. Since the Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe has the same mining radius and yield as the Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe , Prospectors are better off using the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe for mining.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Cobalt" Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Cobalt" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no Workshop Javelins .

items.name: Inaris "Crimson" Knife
items.description: The Inaris "Crimson" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing fire damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. Despite what the flavor text says, the Inaris "Crimson" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no workshop Throwing Knives .
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Dawn" Axe
items.description: The Inaris "Dawn" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing Fire damage to targets. Ideally used with the Berserker talent, which increases axe melee damage.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Dias" Axe
items.description: The Inaris "Dias" Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Steel Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees. Unlike other Axes , the Inaris "Dias" Axe is the only Axe that lowers the carry weight of wood by 50% when equipped, making it a valuable tool when transporting wood when paired with the Gatherer's Backpack .
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Dusk" Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Dusk" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no Workshop Javelins .

items.name: Inaris "Ersa" Axe
items.description: The Inaris "Ersa" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing Frost damage to targets. Ideally used with the Berserker talent, which increases axe melee damage.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Gris" Spear
items.description: The Inaris "Gris" Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow
items.description: The Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow is the opposite of the Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow , trading reload speed for a significant boost to overall damage. The Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow can use Crossbow Bolts crafted on planet as well as Bolts crafted in the Workshop .

items.name: Inaris "Lune" Crossbow
items.description: The Inaris "Lune" Crossbow can use Crossbow Bolts crafted on planet as well as Workshop Bolts . Firing faster and dealing more damage than its predecessors, the Inaris "Lune" Crossbow, as a whole, is a must for avid Crossbow users.

items.name: Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe
items.description: The Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Titanium Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while greatly increasing yield. Unlike other pickaxes, the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe is the only pickaxe that reduces the over-encumbrance penalty by 50% when equipped, which makes mobility while over-encumbered bearable when paired with the talent Carry On and Mass Dampener Module s.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Night" Pickaxe
items.description: The Inaris "Night" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat and harvesting Noxious Crust . It deals poison damage to targets, a large amount of damage to armor, has a penalty for mining yield, but also produces Noxious Crust that can be cleaned to produce additional Minerals .
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow
items.description: The Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station . The Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow can use crossbow bolts crafted on planet as well as the bolts crafted in the Workshop .

items.name: Inaris "Sali" Axe
items.description: The Inaris "Sali" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing poison damage to targets and generating Infected Bark when harvesting trees.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Shade" Knife
items.description: The Inaris "Shade" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing poison damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Inaris "Shade" Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshop Throwing Knives .
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Sole" Crossbow
items.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other crossbows, the Inaris "Sole" Crossbow is geared more towards elemental damage. When paired with Bolts that deal elemental damage ( Obsidian Bolts , Larkwell Martinez Charged Bolts , etc), the Inaris "Sole" Crossbow can pack a punch, making it a decent, if not expensive, upgrade to the previous Workshop Crossbows. Dealt elemental damage is not affected by Crossbow talents.

items.name: Inaris "Ventura" Knife
items.description: Grants immunity to normal wounds while held, making it a useful tool when fighting several wolves simultaneously. Does not prevent Deep Wounds . Unlike Throwing Knives , the Inaris "Ventura" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe
items.description: The Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing frost damage to targets.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Iron Axe
items.description: The Iron Axe is the 2nd axe you will unlock during your time on Icarus. It is located at the bottom of the Tier 2 tech tree, right after the Anvil Bench .

items.name: Iron Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

items.name: Iron Knife
items.description: The Iron Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Bone Knife , the Iron Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. It is also the first knife capable of skinning larger fauna such as the Grizzly Bear and Buffalo . An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application of Tool Attachment Packs at an Alteration Bench / Advanced Alteration Bench .

items.name: Iron Pickaxe
items.description: The Iron Pickaxe is the 2nd pickaxe prospectors can unlock during their time on Icarus. The blueprint is located at the bottom of the tier 2 tech tree and is considerably better than the previous Stone Pickaxe , granting a 125% boost to mining efficiency. Like all iron tools, the iron pickaxe is repairable at an Anvil Bench .

items.name: Iron Sledgehammer
items.description: Iron Sledgehammer is a Tier 2 Sledgehammer made with Iron .

items.name: Iron Spear
items.description: The Iron Spear is the first Spear available to prospectors once they reach Tier 2 and serves as an upgrade to its Tier 1 counterparts. Unlike the Iron Javelin , the Iron Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Iron Throwing Knife
items.description: The Iron Throwing Knife is a variant of the Iron Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Iron Knife , the Iron Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Kinetic Rifle
items.description: The Kinetic Rifle is a Legendary Weapon Rifle that can be purchased at the Bio-lab .

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Axe
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Steel Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees. Similar to the Inaris "Dias" Axe , the Larkwell Martinez Axe also reduces the carry weight of wood when equipped.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of the Compound Bow using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Knife
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Knife is the hardest-hitting Workshop knife available. Unlike Throwing Knives , the Larkwell Martinez Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Platinum Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield. Similar to the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe , the Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe reduces the over-encumbrance penalty by 10% when equipped.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Larkwell Martinez Spear
items.description: The Larkwell Martinez Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Longbow
items.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other Bows , the Longbow hits harder than the Wood Bow .

items.name: MXC Axe
items.description: The MXC Axe is the Workshop equivalent of a Stone Axe , providing a minor boost to felling damage and yield.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: MXC Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: MXC Knife
items.description: The MXC Knife is equivalent to Tier 2 Tech like the Iron Knife , giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such as Buffalo and Grizzly Bears . Unlike Throwing Knives , the MXC Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: MXC Pickaxe
items.description: The MXC Pickaxe is the workshop equivalent of a Stone Pickaxe , providing a minor boost to mining yield and efficiency.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: MXC Spear
items.description: The MXC Spear is the first Spear that can be unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Machete
items.description: The Machete is a Tool that can be used to skin Fauna and harvest Carrots, Wheat, shrubbery, etc. similar to Sickles .

items.name: Miasmic Axe
items.description: Miasmic Axe is a Tier 4 Axe made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Miasmic Knife
items.description: Miasmic Knife is a Tier 4 Knife made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Miasmic Pickaxe
items.description: Miasmic Pickaxe is a Tier 4 Pickaxe made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Miasmic Sledgehammer
items.description: Miasmic Sledgehammer is a Tier 4 Sledgehammer made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Miasmic Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike the Miasmic Javelin , the Miasmic Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Miasmic Throwing Knife
items.description: The Miasmic Throwing Knife is a variant of the Miasmic Knife that can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching the Miasmic Knife . Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Obsidian Sledgehammer
items.description: Obsidian Sledgehammer is a Tier 2 Sledgehammer made with Shaped Obsidian . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

items.name: Obsidian Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike the Obsidian Javelin , the Obsidian Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Obsidian Throwing Knife
items.description: The Obsidian Throwing Knife is a variant of the Obsidian Knife that can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching the Obsidian Knife . Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: One-Shot Pistol
items.description: The One-Shot Pistol is an inexpensive early-game Tier 2 handgun that holds one bullet.

items.name: Pistol
items.description: The Pistol is a single-shot 9mm handgun and is a decent upgrade in firepower available to prospectors. It fires 35 rounds of Pistol Ammunition before breaking, so bring a Machining Bench / Repair Bench for long trips.

items.name: Platinum Axe
items.description: The Platinum Axe is a mid/late-game Axe that can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

items.name: Platinum Crossbow
items.description: The Platinum Crossbow is a mid/late game weapon that can penetrate hardened points with a chance to slow targets but has a slower fire rate than Bows .

items.name: Platinum Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

items.name: Platinum Knife
items.description: The Platinum Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Steel Knife , the Platinum Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. Unlike the Platinum Throwing Knife , the Platinum Knife cannot be thrown.

items.name: Platinum Pickaxe
items.description: The Platinum Pickaxe is a mid/late-game Pickaxe that can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

items.name: Platinum Spear
items.description: The Platinum Spear is the first Spear available to prospectors once they reach Tier 3 and serves as an, albeit expensive, upgrade to its Tier 2 counterparts. Unlike the Platinum Javelin , the Platinum Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Platinum Throwing Knife
items.description: The Platinum Throwing Knife is a variant of the Platinum Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Platinum Knife , the Platinum Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Recurve Bow
items.description: The pinnacle of Instinctive Archery, made of Steel and Aluminium , the Recurve Bow hits harder than the Longbow .

items.name: Rusty Shotgun
items.description: A crude version of the Shotgun that fires slower and holds fewer rounds. It uses any type of Shotgun Ammunition .

items.name: Sandworm Bow
items.description: The Sandworm Bow is made with scales from the Sandworm , using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

items.name: Sandworm Knife
items.description: The Sandworm Knife is made with scales obtained from Sandworms . Considering the Sandworm Knife deals the same amount of damage as a Steel Knife , the Sandworm Knife is overshadowed by higher-tier knives and is not worth the effort.

items.name: Sandworm Spear
items.description: The Sandworm Spear is made with scales from Sandworms and can be used for melee combat with reach. Considering the Sandworm Spear deals the same amount of damage as a Bone Spear , the Sandworm Spear is overshadowed by higher-tier spears and currently not worth the effort.

items.name: Sandworm Throwing Knife
items.description: The Sandworm Throwing Knife is a variant of the Sandworm Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Sandworm Knife , the Sandworm Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Semi-Automatic Pistol
items.description: The Semi-Automatic Pistol is a Tier 3 handgun with more ammo capacity than the Pistol . It fires pistol Pistol Ammunition such as Armor Piercing , Explosive , Incendiary , Obsidian or regular 9mm Rounds .

items.name: Shengong "Akira" Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong "Xingxing" Spear
items.description: The Shengong "Xingxing" Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

items.name: Shengong "Zhang Hu" Bow
items.description: The Shengong "Zhang Hu" Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of the Recurve Bow using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

items.name: Shengong 'Lie' Axe
items.description: The Shengong 'Lie' Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Iron Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong 'Qie' Knife
items.description: This knife and others, such as the Shengong 'Sichou' Knife , with the additional attribute that gives increased skinning yield actually has a 230% Yield from Skinning. This is because the additional attribute is multiplicative and not additive, making them better than the Titanium Knife or Inaris "Ventura" Knife at skinning. Unlike Throwing Knives , the Shengong 'Qie' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong 'Sen' Axe
items.description: The Shengong 'Sen' Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Iron Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong 'Shui' Knife
items.description: The Shengong 'Shui' Knife is equivalent to Tier 2 Tech like the Iron Knife , giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such as Buffalo and Grizzly Bears . Unlike Throwing Knives , the Shengong 'Shui' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong 'Sichou' Knife
items.description: This knife and others, such as the Shengong 'Qie' Knife , with the additional attribute that gives increased skinning yield actually has a 230% Yield from Skinning. This is because the additional attribute is multiplicative and not additive, making them better than the Titanium Knife or Inaris "Ventura" Knife at skinning. Unlike Throwing Knives , the Shengong 'Sichou' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe
items.description: The Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Steel Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong 'Tetsuo' Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong CY7 Axe
items.description: The Shengong CY7 Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with the chance to significantly hinder targets. Ideally used with the Berserker talent, which increases axe melee damage.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong CZ4 Bow
items.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows, the Shengong CZ4 Bow is geared more towards elemental damage. When paired with arrows that deal elemental damage ( Obsidian Arrows , Inaris "Netch" Arrows , etc), the Shengong CZ4 Bow can pack a punch, making it a decent, if not expensive, upgrade to the previous Shengong Bows. Dealt elemental damage is not affected by Bow talents.

items.name: Shengong DL7 Knife
items.description: The Shengong DL7 Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with a chance to significantly hinder targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Shengong DL7 Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshop Throwing Knives .
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shengong HS2 Bow
items.description: The Shengong HS2 Bow is a stronger variant of the Shengong Bows using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows. Despite the Shengong HS2 Bow dealing 35% less damage than the Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow , the Shengong HS2 Bow is unmatched in reload speed and fire rate; perfect for the Prospector who wants to fill the skies with arrows.

items.name: Shengong PF1 Spear
items.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Shengong PF1 Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no Workshop Javelins .

items.name: Shengong UT5 Pickaxe
items.description: The Shengong UT5 Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with the chance to significantly hinder targets. Since the Shengong UT5 Pickaxe has the same mining radius and yield as the Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe , Prospectors are better off using the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe for mining.
items.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Workshop Repair Kitat a poweredRepair Bench

items.name: Shotgun
items.description: The Shotgun is one of the first Firearms available to prospectors. Using 12-Gauge Buckshot Shell for ammunition, the Shotgun is more powerful than the Bolt Action Rifle at close range. However, damage decreases rapidly as range increases, and prospectors should not rely on it for long-range encounters with the Fauna of Icarus. The Shotgun can fire 100 rounds before breaking, and the talent Gunsmith can increase this to up to a maximum of 125 rounds, so bring a Machining Bench for long trips.

items.name: Smoke Grenade
items.description: A smoke grenade is a canister-type grenade used as a signaling device, target or landing zone marking device, or as a screening device for unit movements. Upon detonation, the Smoke Grenade will cover the area in smoke and will obstruct the vision of creatures within the smoke. However, it will not stop creatures that are already aggressively pursuing Prospectors, creatures spawned by Thumpers, Radars, or other mission items that have been placed or activated. Stacks up to 5.

items.name: Steel Axe
items.description: The Steel Axe is a mid-game Tool available in Icarus. Prospectors can unlock it in Tier 2 of the Tech Tree , after reaching Level 20.

items.name: Steel Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

items.name: Steel Knife
items.description: The Steel Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Iron Knife , the Steel Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application of Tool Attachment Packs at an Alteration Bench / Advanced Alteration Bench .

items.name: Steel Pickaxe
items.description: The Steel pickaxe is the 3rd pickaxe prospectors can unlock during your time on Icarus and allows for the mining of denser Minerals not obtainable with the Iron Pickaxe or Stone Pickaxe . Like iron tools, the steel pickaxe is made and is repairable at an Anvil Bench .

items.name: Steel Spear
items.description: The Steel Spear is an upgrade to the Iron Spear that deals more damage/critical damage to targets and has twice the durability. Unlike the Steel Javelin , the Steel Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Steel Throwing Knife
items.description: The Steel Throwing Knife is a variant of the Steel Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Steel Knife , the Steel Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Stone Axe
items.description: The Stone Axe is used primarily for chopping down trees and Small Trees , reducing them to usable Wood . In the process of chopping apart fallen trees, a small number of Sticks may be added to your inventory automatically.

items.name: Stone Knife
items.description: The first knife that can be unlocked, the Stone Knife is a fast melee weapon and doubles as a tool with any knife being necessary to skin a carcass prior to unlocking the Skinning Bench .

items.name: Stone Throwing Knife
items.description: The Stone Throwing Knife is a variant of the Stone Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Stone Knife , the Stone Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of 5 and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Submachine Gun
items.description: The Submachine Gun is a compact firearm with low projectile and critical damage, but a high rate of fire. It uses Pistol Ammunition such as Armor Piercing , Explosive , Incendiary , Obsidian or regular 9mm Rounds .

items.name: Tactical Bow
items.description: The Tactical Bow is an advanced bow that is part of the Great Hunts Campaigns DLC on Prometheus . It fires any type of Arrow and can be upgraded in the Bio-lab .

items.name: Taxidermy Knife
items.description: The Taxidermy Knife is used for skinning Fauna carcasses, when a prospector wishes to obtain a Vestige for mounting. Skinning any carcass with a taxidermy knife grants four Bestiary points for the animal skinned.

items.name: Titanium Axe
items.description: The Titanium Axe is the highest tiered Axe that can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

items.name: Titanium Crossbow
items.description: The Titanium Crossbow is an upgrade to the Platinum Crossbow that offers a boost to projectile damage and a slightly larger ammo count; has a chance to slow targets and can fully penetrate hardened points, but has a slower fire rate than Bows .

items.name: Titanium Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

items.name: Titanium Knife
items.description: The Titanium Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Platinum Knife , the Titanium Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. Unlike the Titanium Throwing Knife , the Titanium Knife cannot be thrown.

items.name: Titanium Pickaxe
items.description: The Titanium Pickaxe is the highest-tiered Pickaxe that can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus. When combined with a Tool Attachment Pack / Advanced Tool Attachment Pack , the Titanium Pickaxe surpasses the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe in terms of mining.

items.name: Titanium Spear
items.description: The Titanium Spear is the first Spear available to prospectors once they reach Tier 4 and serves as an, albeit expensive, upgrade to its Tier 3 counterparts. Unlike the Titanium Javelin , the Titanium Spear cannot be thrown.

items.name: Titanium Throwing Knife
items.description: The Titanium Throwing Knife is a variant of the Titanium Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Titanium Knife , the Titanium Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

items.name: Tomato & Egg Bowl
items.description: Tomato & Egg Bowl is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Trench Shotgun
items.description: An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application of Ranged Attachment Packs at an Alteration Bench / Advanced Alteration Bench . Devastating up close when paired with the Barrel Widening Attachment / Narrow Barrel Attachment s and the Larkwell Martinez Mercenary Backpack .

items.name: Wood Bow
items.description: The Wood Bow is the first bow a player can get access to. It can be unlocked via the Tech Tree in Tier 1 with no prerequisite tech required.

items.name: Wood Hammer
items.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

items.name: Wood Spear
items.description: The Wood Spear is the first Spear available to prospectors and serves as an alternative to the Stone Knife , dealing increased critical damage but with a slower attack speed. Like other spears, the Wood Spear increase the range to which prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high.
